Error in temperature rising of Fixing Assembly
Temperature of the Fixing Assembly did not reach a certain temperature within the specified period of time.
1. Check the connector connection between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Abnormal high temperature of Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly was abnormally high.
1. Check the connector connection between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Abnormal high temperature of Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly (Sub Thermistor) was abnormally high.
1. Check the connector connection between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Abnormal low temperature of Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly was abnormally low.
1. Check the connector connection between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Abnormal low temperature of Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly (Sub Thermistor) was abnormally low.
1. Check the connector connection between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Error in fixing power supply drive circuit
The zero cross signal was not detected for the specified period of time or more.
1. Check the connector connection between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
An error in the initial operation of the Drum Motor was detected.
1. Reconnect the connector of the Main Motor. 2. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Rotation error of the Drum Motor was detected.
1. Reconnect the connector of the Main Motor. 2. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Error in startup of the Main Motor
Revolution of the Main Motor did not reach the specified value.
1. Check the connector connection between the Main Motor and the Engine Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Main Motor. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Error in startup of the Main Motor
Revolution of the Main Motor was out of the specified range.
1. Check the connector connection between the Main Motor and the Engine Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Main Motor. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Connection of the Duplex Feed Unit was not correct.
BD cycle of the Laser Scanner Unit was not within the specified range.

1. Check the connector connection between the Main Controller PCB and the Laser Scanner Unit. 2. Check the connector connection between the Relay PCB and the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit.
An error in the initial operation of the Scanner Motor in the Laser Scanner Unit was detected.

1. Check the connector connection between the Main Controller PCB and the Laser Scanner Unit. 2. Check the connector connection between the Relay PCB and the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit.
Update of the DCON was failed. (RFU mode right after the startup)
Error in writing/reading of the setting values storage area in the Main Controller PCB
1. Install the set of the controller firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
An error occurred when writing/reading data to/ from the ROM.
1. Install the set of the controller firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
An error occurred when writing/reading data to/ from the ROM.
1. Install the set of the controller firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
The CIS Unit did not move to HP even it moved backward. Reader HP Sensor error, Reader Motor error, CIS Unit error
1. Replace the Reader HP Sensor. 2. Replace the Reader Motor. 3. Replace the CIS Unit. 4. Replace the Reader Unit.
The CIS Unit did not move to HP even it moved forward. Reader HP Sensor error, Reader Motor error, CIS Unit error
1. Replace the Reader HP Sensor. 2. Replace the Reader Motor. 3. Replace the CIS Unit. 4. Replace the Reader Unit.
Light intensity of the CIS Unit below the reference level
When the light intensity is below the reference level at shading
1. Disconnect and then connect the Flexible Cable. 2. Replace the Flexible Cable. 3. Replace the CIS Unit. 4. Replace the Main Controller PCB (PCB2).
Communication with the Card Reader could not be started at startup.

1. After tuning OFF the power, check the connection of the Card Reader-F1 and the short connector [A], and turn ON the power. 2. After turning OFF the power, replace the cable included in the package of the Card Reader-F1 or the Copy Card Reader Attachment- J1, and turn ON the power.
1. Install the set of the controller firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Communication error between the Engine Controller PCB and the Main Controller PCB occurred.

1. Check the connector connection between the Engine Controller PCB and the Main Controller PCB. 2. Install the set of the controller firmware. 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB. 4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB.
Error in ROM for backing up fax data
An error occurred in ROM for backing up fax data
1. Install the set of the controller firmware. 2. Replace the NCU PCB. 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB.

1. Turn OFF and then ON the main power. 2. Check the Engine Controller PCB. 3. Install the Engine Controller PCB. 4. Install the set of the controller firmware. 5. Check the model code. (When the model code and the engine code are mismatched, E744-4000 occurs.)
Error in the Control Panel PCB
Error in the Control Panel PCB (microcomputer)
1. Check the Control Panel PCB, and install the firmware (PANEL). 2. Install the set of the controller firmware. 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Communication error with Wireless LAN PCB
Communication with the Wireless LAN PCB could not be established.

1. Turn OFF and then ON the main power. 2. Check the connection of the Wireless LAN PCB. 3. Install the set of the controller firmware. 4. Replace the Wireless LAN PCB. 5. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
The Sub Fan was locked for a specified consecutive period of time.
1. Check the connection of the Sub Fan. 2. Replace the Sub Fan.
The Main Fan was locked for a specified consecutive period of time.
1. Check the connection of the Main Fan. 2. Replace the Main Fan.
Printer detected low-voltage power supply failure.
